page.title: 08MODERN DAIRYFARMING,ST.ALLEN
page.content: Boswellick is a 180acre dairy & arable farm owned & occupied by Mr.& Mrs. Carveth with 3 daughters;with 2 full- time workers from Truro & Allet.Dairy- farming was encouraged in 1978,&modern cattle accommodation was built.Milk quotas have now forced a cut-back in herd size.60 Friesian cows are milked in a herringbone parlour,with 5 being milked & 5 washed down at a time.From October or November,depending on weather,to April when grass is growing cattle are in a cubicle-house with computerised feeding;each cow wears an electronic collar device & receives a controlled quota daily,divided into hourly amounts,with correct nutrients for each cow's requirements based on lactation stage.Calves are similarly fed from a milk machine.Cows also have access to self-feed silage. Heifer calves are kept as dairy-followers.
